meanings.definition: To incorrectly paginate or number pages in a document or book.
meanings.sent1: She kept mispaging the report, causing confusion for everyone.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't mispage the chapters when I print the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: John mispaged the manual so badly that it looked like a jumbled mess.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a book mispaging the chapters of her life.
meanings.sent5: The mispaging of the document led to a mix-up in the order of events.

meanings.definition: The act of mistakenly turning to the wrong page in a book or document.
meanings.sent1: His constant mispaging made it hard to follow the story.
meanings.sent2: The mispaging of the atlas made finding countries a challenge.
meanings.sent3: The mispaging of the recipe book resulted in a hilarious cooking disaster.
meanings.sent4: Her mispaging was like a treasure hunt, always searching for the right page.
meanings.sent5: The mispaging of the manual caused frustration during the exam.
